programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.desc: Spain and Germany will clash in Stuttgart in a repeat of the EURO 2008 final. Spain beat Germany 1-0 in the final in Vienna courtesy of a Fernando Torres goal. Both Spain and Germany have won the European Championships a record three times.

programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: Spain and France go head-to-head in a battle for a place in the EURO 2024 final in Berlin. It is a repeat of the 1984 European Championships final, when Les Bleus beat La Roja 2-0 in Paris, courtesy of goals by Michel Platini and Bruno Bellone.

programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: Spain and England face each other in the final of EURO 2024 in Berlin. The Three Lions won both previous encounters with Spain at the EUROs, including a win on penalties in the EURO 1996 quarter-finals at Wembley Stadium (0-0, 4-2 win on penalties).

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: LeBron James had 35 points and 11 rebounds, Austin Reaves scored seven of his 15 points in overtime and the Los Angeles Lakers snapped an 11-game losing streak against the Los Angeles Clippers with a 130-125 victory. From Nov. 1, 2023.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Miles Bridges hit a 3-pointer with 6.6 seconds left in overtime and the Charlotte Hornets snapped a six-game home losing streak with an improbable 121-118 come-from-behind win over the red hot Boston Celtics. From Nov. 20, 2023.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: The Cleveland Cavaliers continued their winning ways as Darius Garland scored 32 points and Jarrett Allen added 26 in a 122-119 overtime win over the Philadelphia 76ers in the NBA In-Season Tournament. From Nov. 21, 2023.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Trae Young scored a season-high 43 points, including 14 in overtime, and the Hawks outlasted Brooklyn 147-145. Mikal Bridges tied a career high with 45 points, 11 in OT, and grabbed 10 rebounds for the Nets. From Nov. 22, 2023.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Giannis Antetokounmpo had 32 points and 12 rebounds to lead the Milwaukee Bucks to a 133-129 victory over the Chicago Bulls in overtime. DeMar DeRozan had 41 points and Coby White scored 33 for Chicago, which had won four straight.

programme.desc: Manu Ginobili scores 48 points, Tim Duncan scores 30 points and 19 rebounds and the Spurs rally from a 17-point 4th quarter deficit to defeat the Suns. From Jan. 21, 2005.

programme.desc: Tyrese Maxey scored a career-high 50 points, Joel Embiid had 37 points and the Philadelphia 76ers improved to 8-1 with their eighth straight victory, beating the Indiana Pacers 137-126. From Nov. 12, 2023.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Tyrese Maxey scored a career-high 51 points hours after being selected to his first All-Star Game, helping the Philadelphia 76ers overcome star center Joel Embiid's absence for a 127-124 victory over the Utah Jazz. From Feb. 1, 2024.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Devin Booker scored 52 points, the fifth-highest scoring game of his career, to power the Phoenix Suns to a 124-111 victory over the New Orleans Pelicans. From April 1, 2024.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Giannis Antetokounmpo scored a franchise-record 64 points to help the Milwaukee Bucks outscore the Indiana Pacers 140-126, with Antetokounmpo then at the center of a post-game confrontation over the game ball. From Dec. 13, 2023.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Stephen Curry scored a season-high 60 points, hitting 10-of-23 three-pointers, in the Warriors' 141-134 overtime loss to Trae Young and the Atlanta Hawks. Young led the Hawks with 35 points while Dejounte Murray added 19 points. From Feb. 3, 2024.

programme.title: The Doctor
programme.desc: The definitive look at Julius "Dr. J" Erving's life and career--growing up in New York, playing in the ABA, and winning a NBA championship with the Philadelphia 76ers.

programme.desc: Two members of the NBA 75th Anniversary Team - Charles Barkley and Julius "Dr. J." Erving - are featured in this basketball documentary.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Jerami Grant scored a season-high 30 points, including a baseline jumper at the buzzer, to lift the short-handed Portland Trail Blazers over the Phoenix Suns 108-106. Devin Booker led the Suns with 25 points. From Nov. 4, 2022.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: De'Aaron Fox knocked down a 3 as time expired as the Kings beat the Magic, 126-123, in OT. Fox recorded 37 points, five rebounds and three assists for the Kings, while Paolo Banchero tallied a career-high 33 points and 16 rebounds. From Nov. 5, 2022.
